WRITING.TEXT: Last week she said she was sad when she watched the episode because she saw what everyone was saying about her and that wasn't her perception out there so I imagine this week will be even harder for her.
Yeah Michaela is nowhere near as socially inept as Abi
Lol what Hali are you watching, she literally just rolled over and died.
It's ok, in 6 days people will find a new person to bitch about constantly. My money's on it being Troyzan or Sarah.
I love it. I imagine it'll get old at some point but it's great now
Cirie, Aubry, Andrea, Michaela
Are we convinced Sarah is gonna stick with them though? Sarah seems pretty content to stay in the middle.
I think Tai said in pregame press that he felt betrayed after watching KR and didn't trust Aubry anymore.

I think they saw that all of the favorites were about to be picked off by the non game changers, knew someone from the minority would be on that bench, and put an advantage there to save the alliance. Unfortunately it didn't work out at all.
Being confident is a death knell in survivor. I'm just surprised that after 34 seasons there are players who don't realize that.
Not to mention it was a completely stupid decision. Having Cirie on a team instead of her ended up costing that team the victory.
An uninformed opinion is less valid than an informed one, yes.
They'll only last you like 2 hours but you're welcome ;)
Sandra ate the rest to create drama that would take the target off her back. And then she voted with Michaela. You're a stupid ass
We've seen like two people say that. We've also seen a lot of people outside of the game say the opposite. Don't be so quick to buy into the edit.

Go read some exit interviews. And you're delusional if you think, on a remote island with barely any food for 6 weeks, that even close to everyone is going to like you even if you're the most likable person out there. People get on each other's nerves, it's called survivor.
Like two weeks I think she's said
Nah I'm pretty sure most people agree with Andrea that Zeke is a bad player. Like two people dislike Michaela. The rest love her.
And then praised her in exit interviews. Sorry but saying one negative thing about someone doesn't mean you don't like them
It's really not. You'd have to be a really selective listener to ignore BOTH of those nos.
No, they don't. Why don't you go read some threads after last night because you're clearly unaware of this subs general attitude
Or, you've just met assholes all day. I hate that stupid fucking saying.
You said it yourself "this sub isn't the jury." Believe it or not half the people out there actually really like Michaela.
Yeah that's straight up not true. People can't stand Zeke and Troyzan is completely useless.
Yep there have been 4 episodes so far
You're completely making shit up lol fuck off
Why does JT get the benefit of the doubt? Multiple people have said they don't like Michaela, sure, but multiple people have also said that JT's dislike of her was unfounded and potentially racist.

Yeah seriously the circlejerk is getting so old. Must we have a "most hated player" of the week every week, and find any reason to hate them, and ignore any redeeming qualities about them? This sub is just getting pathetic at this point. Or maybe it's always been that way, idk.
That's not even true lol. JT, Sierra, Brad, and Debbie have had problems with her, yes, but Cirie, Sandra, Varner, and Hali have all loved her.
I've said it before and I'll say it again: This season could desperately use some Lillian Morris.
Let's not go too crazy. Hali, Cirie, Troyzan, and Andrea all like her well enough.
Yeah seriously everyone's picking the fuck out of this confessional but it made total sense to me. People just be looking for something to be angry about
Implying this season can even be saved.
And let's be honest, as annoying as she can be sometimes, she gives fucking fantastic confessionals. She's so well-spoken.
I love that Aubry did that, but was it a good move? Screwing over Debbie last time was a big reason why she lost the game. It seems as though Aubry hasn't learned much about jury management.
Debbie flairs are irate
Yeah wtf? I've never seen a more blatant misquote to fit a post before.
The second season is so good, you should look into it.
You think she would lose in a F3 against Troyzan and Zeke?
What fucking world are you living in? Kass did not try and mend fences with Tasha. She tried to get information from her to screw over her alliance.

Yeah and they were playing in a season called *Second Chances*. The entire point of the season was learning from your past mistakes, and given that they were playing with some of the same people from their last season, it only made sense to not trust them again.

She had such a weird edit this season. She had the most confessionals of anyone up to tonight, didn't go a single episode without a confessional (a feat only shared by Tai), and was given one of the opening confessionals. All to be the third jury member?
Or Michaela or Brad fill that position since they were both premerge
I think that Debbie was the only person Sarah would've gone for. She had decided to stick with the 6 and then the minority's only pitch to her was that Debbie was throwing her under the bus.
Debbie's fatal flaw is that she gets overconfident. It's too bad because she's proven that she is capable of being a gifted player, but she's just as capable of being an awful one.
I wish the rest of this season would just be replaced with the prejury trip footage.

Let it be known that it's not some universal fact that she's difficult to be with. Yes, JT, Sierra, Brad, and Debbie have had a problem with her, but on the other side of the coin, Sandra, Varner, Hali, and Cirie have all loved her.

What you're saying is a complete revisionist history. Her attitude wasn't what brought her down last time (and she didn't see what brought her down last time before playing in GC), what brought her down last time was her reputation as a big challenge threat come postmerge. She had a tight alliance last time who didn't mind her attitude.

She did learn something though. Heck, her entire game is completely different this time. She's been holding herself back in every possible way in order to not piss people off or look like a target. Did she take it too far? Yeah, but you can't say she didn't learn from her mistakes. Also, I think it's important to consider the fact that this season was two weeks after her original season. She never got to see her season air before playing so it was probably hard to understand what really went wrong the first time.

I mean it makes sense considering she applied to be on the Amazing Race, not survivor. And I think you're not giving her enough credit. Socially she's pretty bad, but physically she's a great player and she isn't bad strategically.
I think Debbie being so graceful about it made it somewhat less satisfying.
and attack on titan, although I'm not really sure that's on television
No, I'm not. We have a Brad-Sierra-Troyzan-Tai, potentially Sarah, alliance that has three idols, a legacy advantage, and potentially a vote steal. This is worst case scenario shit right here.
would HAVE
I definitely don't feel that way, but I suppose now that Debbie is out this sub needs a new person to hate so
I'm loving it. I've never really been an Andrea fan and even premerge she was pretty lame, but this fire is what I needed from her.

I think that that Shark comment was more referring to the Ciera vote, how no one really wanted to make a big move out of the gate and instead just went with the safe vote so they wouldn't be the ones caught in the crosshairs or the shark's jaw.

It's bizarre to me how many repeat moments we're getting this season. It feels like this season is just a compilation of past survivor moments. I loved the coleslaw throwback but besides that there are so many things that seem identical to the person's original season, like Zeke being a gamebot and trying to make a big move, JT stupidly screwing his alliance for the other side, Sarah being the swing vote, etc.

What if Aubry flipped Tai again? How incredible would that be?
Seriously though, I'm so proud of Aubry after tonight. She seems to be hitting her stride again after a very long time of being outplayed.
There's only going to be 9 people in two weeks

She wasn't saying it as if it made her special or something, she was saying it because it was her job, and that job skill helped her out in the game.
Actually it's coincidence

It would've been a cool way once, but having a completely identical one at a separate camp, with so many tribe swaps this season, was just asking for one person to find two idols for the price of one.
And I love how every single one of them is being picked up by the "Super 6". This season is a trainwreck lmao
I just realized...Crush...Squirt...the turtles are named after citrus pops.

Idk I agree it has a great sense of pace and emotion, but to me it just lacks the sophistication of Spirited Away. It's entertaining, well-written, well-animated, and heartwarming, for sure, but it just lacks a certain it-factor that Spirited Away had.
I'm an anime only viewer, but really I kinda saw it coming throughout the episode. It was still a pretty cool moment when it was confirmed though.

I think just with Natalie Anderson
Andrea, Cirie, or Debbie goes home.

Just admit you messed up and ask if there's any way you can make it up. I think most professors would value honesty and the desire to rectify your mistakes than some excuse. Anyways I would definitely talk to them, they may say no, but that's the worst that can happen and you really have nothing to lose at this point.
It's always been my favorite challenge to watch. Idk why it's so cathartic watching a bunch of people bid on and eat delicious foods and luxuries but it is so satisfying.
What difference does it make? Being self-aware of doing something wrong does not make that thing right when you continue to do it. Self-awareness is pointless if you're not willing to change.
Yeah I know and that's a great Justice story but that doesn't happen to most bad auditioners
That guitarist is cute af though
Yeah you would think people whose sole source of income is through a video sharing website would be more adaptable and comfortable with instability. Guess not.

I have no sympathy for people who can't adapt to the market. If you want to get paid for making youtube videos, you have to make videos people want to pay you for, period. You can't go "WHY WON'T THEY MONETIZE MY PEEING JOKE?!" you have to say "alright, they aren't going to monetize the peeing joke, time to come up with a new joke they will monetize." Good riddance.
Honestly fuck the preliminary judges who put people like this through just to have a second of entertainment at the expense of the person.

I mean you're completely ignoring any context. She was brought back with Phillip, the same person that led the charge to get her out the first time. Of course she went home first again. I think if she was brought back without Phillip she would last a while.
She flipped a 4-2 majority on its head, was the only one who could handle Abi and eventually get her out, and she was the driving force behind a lot of her alliance's votes.
No her FTC sucked, it was the rest of her game that was good.
Completely agree about Lisa. Is there anyone who doesn't want Francesca back a third time though?!
I don't necessarily hate him but his constant blind defense of JT rubs me the wrong way. Why should I buy anything that comes from his mouth when he's proven himself to be that partial and biased?
said the same thing and got downvoted lol. Reddit's so fickle.
Idk the constant cuts to her made it seem like she would win. I feel like they've done something similar with challenges before. Damn people it's just speculation no need to downvote.

you know this sub loves doing that
I'd rather Zeke goes home. To me he's an insufferably bad player and tries way too hard to be a superfan.

Same. Unfortunately I doubt it will go that way. Based on how bad the boot order has been so far, we'll probably lose Cirie, Aubry, and Andrea as the next 3. Especially because we've already seen how dedicated Nuku is to pagonging people.

WRITING.TITLE: let's talk about how weird marquesas is
WRITING.TEXT: First of all, the Rotu 4 alliance. There's just something about all of the that's...off and it makes me uncomfortable. I feel like they're all aliens or something. And Vecepia is just such a bizarre winner to me, her game is really hard to qualify and she isn't as well-regarded as the other early winners were. And then there's the fact that the reunion show was hosted by Rosie O'Donnell...I don't know this season feels like a survivor fever dream to me.
bad time to be a nudist
yeah but at least you don't have a 4 year gap in between each arc
I don't think they're the same. Ymir has the pointed teeth and her nose is more down-turned.

I knew Ymir would be a titan, or at least that she was hiding something, the second she could read that can.
Disappointment? Those songs they started playing were better than the shit they were supposed to be playing.

I know for me it was hard to tell if she was good because the audience wasn't really cheering. It sounds dumb, but I don't know anything about figure skating and it all looks pretty similar so one of the ways to gauge how good it actually is is the audience's reaction.
I kept waiting for something interesting to happen but it never did. Have you watched many dance videos on youtube?
